Administration.text:
Type: Skeletal muscle relaxant
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: IV, oral
Common Trade Names: Dantrium

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: contraindicated in acute hepatitis or active cirrhosis

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Acute hepatitis or active cirrhosis

Serious.text:
Hepatotoxicity
GI bleed
Aplastic anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, small lymphocytic lymphoma
Muscle weakness, dysphagia, reduced vital capacity, dyspnea

Common.text:
Flushing
Somnolence, fatigue, malaise
Nausea, diarrhea

Serious.text:
Hepatotoxicity

Aplastic anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, small lymphocytic lymphoma
Muscle weakness, dysphagia, reduced vital capacity, dyspnea

Flushing
Somnolence, fatigue, malaise
Nausea, diarrhea

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Interferes with release of calcium ions from sarcoplasmic reticulum in skeletal muscle, which results in dissociation of the excitation-contraction coupling
